description: Squarefree n with no 4k+3 factors such that Pell equation x^2 - n y^2 = -1 is insoluble.
comments: Or, numbers n which are the sum of two relatively-prime squares but for which x^2 - n*y^2 does not represent -1.Together with {1} and A003654 forms a disjoint partition of A020893. That is, A020893 = {1} U A003654 U A031398. [From _Max Alekseyev_, Mar 09 2010]
references: J. P. Robertson and K. R. Matthews, A continued fraction approach to a result of Feit, Amer. Math. Monthly, 115 (No. 4, 2008), 346-349.
links: Jean-François Alcover, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
mathematica: sel = Select[Range[2000], SquareFreeQ[#] && FreeQ[Mod[FactorInteger[#][[All, 1]], 4], 3]&]; r[n_] := Reduce[x^2-n*y^2 == -1, {x, y}, Integers]; Reap[For[n=1, n <= Length[sel], n++, an = sel[[n]]; If[r[an] === False, Print[an]; Sow[an]]]][[2, 1]] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Feb 04 2014 *)
author: _David W. Wilson_
extensions: Edited by _N. J. A. Sloane_, Apr 28 2008, at the suggestion of Artur Jasinski.
